poem:
Title: The Unseen Shift

Calm in steel's silence, Elizabeth bows,
Starboard turned sulky at a flaw's disclosure.
Unsung heroes, in grimy overalls, furrow brows,
Yet, royal duty unsatisfied festers in Portsmouth's closure.

Prince, a swift shadow readied under urgency's lance,
Eclipses sister, an abrupt eclipse shrouded in haste.
Such is the Naval dance, tuned to chance,
In unseen shifts that the maritime taste.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Why is HMS Prince of Wales replacing HMS Queen Elizabeth on Nato mission? HMS Queen Elizabeth, one of Britain’s two flagship aircraft carriers, was forced to pull out of a Nato exercise off the Norwegian coast after pre-sailing checks uncovered a coupling problem on its starboard propeller shaft. Plans to set sail from Portsmouth on Sunday were abandoned and sister vessel HMS Prince of Wales is being readied hastily to take its place. Didn’t another". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
